prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC1512 ALMA Band 3 (CO1-0 + continuum)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to map the dust continuum with ALMA Band 3 as well as the CO(1-0) line in an extranuclear region of the nearby galaxy NGC1512 where submm excess emission has been detected. We will combine these observations with observations in Band-6 and Band-7 to investigate the local variations of the submm/mm continuum with respect to the molecular gas reservoirs traced by CO and PAHs to resolve the submm excess and disentangle between the various scenarios of its origin. We will probe the molecular gas kinematics in the outer ring and relate the gas to the dust reservoirs. We will also compare the spatial distribution of the gas clumps, AGB stars, diffuse cold dust emission to the PAH emission in order to study their formation mechanisms in galactic disks.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: For the correlator setup, we select the 'spectral line' spectral type, with dual polarisation and 4 spectral windows. One window will encompass the CO(1-0) line while the other 3 windows will probe the dust continuum, one of the main objectives of this proposal. We choose a bandwidth of 1875 MHz (large velocity range for continuum measurements), with an element resolution of 31.250 MHz.

Combined with Band-6 and Band-7 observations, Band-3 observations aim to spatially compare the distribution of the cold dust distribution with respect to the PAH carriers as well as the molecular gas reservoirs. We select an angular resolution of 2'' (~110pc for NGC1512) in order to match the resolution of the Spitzer/8um maps, tracer of the PAH emission.
We expect contiguous features between the various clumps in the field, so we fix the largest angular structure in source to the typical separation between clumps, 12. As this is lower than the maximum recoverable scale for the chosen configuration, Atacama Compact Array time will not be required.

The total dust mass of the galaxy is 1.8 x 10^7 Msolar. Using a G/D=430 for a metallicity of Z=8.56 (see predictions from Remy-Ruyer et al. (2014)), we derive a total gas mass of 9 x 10^9 Msolar. The HI mass is 6?10^9 Msolar (Koribalski & Lopez-Sanchez, 2009). This suggests that the molecular gas mass is half of the HI mass at most. Koribalski & Lopez-Sanchez (2009) has predicted a molecular mass of about a third of the HI mass in NGC1512, thus ~2?10^9 Msolar. We use this conservative value for the following calculations. Using a Galactic CO-to-H2 conversion factor of 3.45 Mpc^2 (K km s-1)-1 (Strong et al. 1988), we derive a map of the expected ICO(1-0) intensity (see science case). We want to recover faint structures of 4 K.km.s^-1 (the peak is at 9.5 K.km.s^-1 in our ICO(1-0) predicted map). Using a S/N=5 and a conservative line width of 50 km.s^-1, we aim to reach a sensitivity of 36mK at a velocity resolution of 10 km.s^-1 equivalent to a desired mosaic sensitivity of 1.5mJy per synthesized beam (2 arcsec).

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC1512 ALMA Band 6 (continuum)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to map the dust continuum with ALMA Band 6 in an extranuclear region of the nearby galaxy NGC1512 where submm excess emission has been detected (the continuum setup for Band-6 will include the CO(2-1) line in one of the Basebands). We will combine this observation with observations in Band-3 and Band-7 to investigate the local variations of the submm/mm continuum with respect to the molecular gas reservoirs traced by CO and PAHs to resolve the submm excess and disentangle between the various scenarios of its origin. We will probe the molecular gas kinematics in the outer ring and relate the gas to the dust reservoirs. We will also compare the spatial distribution of the gas clumps, AGB stars, diffuse cold dust emission to the PAH emission in order to study their formation mechanisms in galactic disks.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: For the correlator setup, we select the 'single continuum' spectral type, with dual polarisation and 4 spectral windows. We choose a sky frequency of 233.9 GHz. This setup for Band-6 has been chosen to emcompass the CO(2-1) line. We choose a bandwidth of 1875 MHz (large velocity range for continuum measurements), with a smoothed resolution of 31.250 MHz.

Combined with Band-3 and Band-7 observations, Band-6 observations aim to spatially compare the distribution of the cold dust distribution with respect to the PAH carriers as well as the molecular gas reservoirs. We would like to resolve the dust and gas reservoirs at a resolution of 2'' (~110pc for NGC1512) in order to match the resolution of the Spitzer/8um maps, tracer of the PAH emission. We thus set the angular resolution to the largest angular resolution provided by the most compact 12-m array configuration, thus 1.4'' in Band-6.
We expect contiguous features between the various clumps in the field, so we fix the largest angular structure in source to the typical separation between clumps, 12. As this is larger than the maximum recoverable scale, structures larger than this will be recovered using the Atacama Compact Array.

We wish to reach a S/N of 5. The expected sensitivity is ~140-160uJy / synthesized beam (1.4'') at 870um and 5 times higher at 500um. We used the Herschel/SPIRE and LABOCA data to extrapolate the submm SED and estimate the expected flux density in the targeted field in Band 6. This leads to a conservative desired continuum rms of 45uJy over the total bandwidth (7.5GHz).
We choose a sky frequency of 233.9 GHz. This setup for Band-6 has been chosen to emcompass the CO(2-1) line in Baseband-2.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC1512 ALMA Band 7 (CO(3-2) + continuum)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to map the dust continuum with ALMA Band 7 as well as the CO(3-2) line in an extranuclear region of the nearby galaxy NGC1512 where submm excess emission has been detected. We will combine these observations with observations in Band-3 and Band-6 to investigate the local variations of the submm/mm continuum with respect to the molecular gas reservoirs traced by CO and PAHs to resolve the submm excess and disentangle between the various scenarios of its origin. We will probe the molecular gas kinematics in the outer ring and relate the gas to the dust reservoirs. We will also compare the spatial distribution of the gas clumps, AGB stars, diffuse cold dust emission to the PAH emission in order to study their formation mechanisms in galactic disks.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: For the correlator setup, we select the 'spectral line' spectral type, with dual polarisation and 4 spectral windows. One window will encompass the CO(3-2) line while the other 3 windows will probe the dust continuum, one of the main objectives of this proposal. We choose a bandwidth of 1875 MHz (large velocity range for continuum measurements), with a smoothed resolution of 31.250 MHz for the continuum observations.

Combined with Band-3 and Band-6 observations, Band-7 observations aim to spatially compare the distribution of the cold dust distribution with respect to the PAH carriers as well as the molecular gas reservoirs. We would like to resolve the dust and gas reservoirs at a resolution of 2'' (~110pc for NGC1512) in order to match the resolution of the Spitzer/8um maps, tracer of the PAH emission. We thus set the angular resolution to the largest angular resolution provided by the most compact 12-m array configuration, thus 1'' in Band-7.
We expect contiguous features between the various clumps in the field, so we fix the largest angular structure in source to the typical separation between clumps, 12. As this is larger than the maximum recoverable scale, structures larger than this will be recovered using the Atacama Compact Array.

The total dust mass of the galaxy is 1.8 x 10^7 Msolar. Using a G/D=430 for a metallicity of Z=8.56 (predictions using Remy-Ruyer et al. (2014)), we derive a total gas mass of 9 x 10^9 Msolar. The HI mass is 6?10^9 Msolar (Koribalski & Lopez-Sanchez, 2009). This suggests that the molecular gas mass is half of the HI mass at most. Koribalski & Lopez-Sanchez (2009) has predicted a molecular mass of about a third of the HI mass in NGC1512, thus ~2?10^9 Msolar. We use this conservative value for the following calculations. Using a Galactic CO-to-H2 conversion factor of 3.45 Mpc^2 (K km s-1)-1 (Strong et al. 1988), we derive a map of the expected ICO(1-0) intensity (see science case). We then used a CO(3-2)/CO(1-0) factor of 0.6 (Warren et al. 2010) to derive a predicted ICO(3-2) map. We want to recover faint structures of 2.4 K.km.s^-1. Using a S/N=5 and a conservative line width of 50 km.s^-1, we aim to reach a sensitivity of 21mK at a velocity resolution of 10 km.s^-1 equivalent to a desired mosaic sensitivity of 2.1mJy per synthesized beam (1 arcsec). This will allow us to also reach a continuum sensitivity similar to the one we derive from our previous LABOCA observations of NGC1512 (70-90uJy / synthesized beam 1'').

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to map the dust continuum and the CO(1-0) and CO(3-2) line emission with ALMA Band 3, 6 and 7 in an extranuclear region of the nearby galaxy NGC1512 where submm excess emission has been detected. We will investigate the local variations of the submm/mm continuum with respect to the molecular gas reservoirs traced by CO and PAHs to resolve the submm excess and disentangle between the various scenarios of its origin. We will probe the molecular gas kinematics in the outer ring and relate the gas to the dust reservoirs. We will also compare the spatial distribution of the gas clumps, AGB stars, diffuse cold dust emission to the PAH emission in order to study their formation mechanisms in galactic disks.
